Your Trusted Home Health Care Partner in Doylestown, PA

Personalized support from a team that puts family first.

Living Care Home Services has been serving your community since 2001. Sean Lynch, the founder of the company has been dedicated to providing compassionate, reliable in-home health care services‚Äîincluding live in caregiver support, home care services, private duty nursing, and occupational and physical therapy, with the purpose to enable clients to remain in the comfort of their own homes and be safe and well cared for by compassionate and skilled caregivers who share the common goal of making life as fulfilling and comforting for you as we would like for our own family members.

On May 1st, 2023, Doylestown natives, Daniel and Jennifer Townsley purchased Living Care Home services from Sean and share the same values that were instilled at the inception of the company 22 years ago. The Townsleys have over 30 years of healthcare business experience and Jennifer is a PA Licensed BSRN and has a B.S. in Psychology.

Daniel and Jennifer are strong believers that any business, especially smaller businesses that are owned and operated by the community they serve have a responsibility to care for each other and support other local businesses that need to thrive for the success of the community. They believe that no matter what the business does, it should treat its clients how they would like to be treated. This especially applies to caring for your loved ones. This is an extremely important decision to make when it comes to providing care for your family and loved ones and they take this responsibility very seriously.

Living Care Home Services is a boutique company that has a bespoke approach to providing care. Not every client is the same and no two families are alike. They take the time to listen to each family individually and then match them with the caregiver that matches what they need. Whether it is for one hour or one year, they will make sure that your unique situation is taken very seriously and that the services are tailored to your specific needs. This is a unique approach to in-home health care that you lose when dealing with large chains that want to just fill a shift with someone who can work the hours. Our Caregivers & Service
Our Caregivers & Service

Compassionate care starts with the right people‚Äîand a service plan built just for your family.

OUR CAREGIVERS

Living Care Home Services is dual licensed as an Agency and Registry, which is very unique in this industry. which is very unique in this industry. This allows them to choose the BEST way to operate vs. being a single licensed facility which most in fact are. Our family of caregivers receive the highest level of training and support available. From the initial phone interview, the face to face interview with the Care Manager or the President, with on-going supervision right through to the exit interview, we strive to learn who our caregivers are as people. We believe that by treating and supporting our caregivers as family, they in turn treat the families they help as family.

All caregivers receive initial training and orientation and undergo an annual re-evaluation and must demonstrate competency as a caregiver as defined by the PA Department of Health guidelines. We ensure that your caregiver meets all requirements of our license including criminal history and background checks, professional reference checks, residency compliance, health and TB tests and have a valid Driver‚Äôs License and proper and current car insurance. All this needs to be in place prior to any caregiver providing services in your home. This is our responsibility, it shouldn‚Äôt have to be yours.

We have caregivers of every skill level to accommodate your needs from simple companionship to 24 hour Live-in care. It is our belief that spending the time to ensure the correct caregiver match, before services begin, is essential in the successful outcome of services rendered. Loved ones are often reluctant to accept help so getting the right caregiver in place from the beginning is important.

FAQs
FAQs

Why should I choose Living Care Home Services?

There are lots of reasons to choose us! We use only the best caregivers who are available. We are family owned with family values who understand family needs. We show up, you can depend on us. We are totally dedicated to providing compassionate, reliable, and affordable care. We have experience, not just as professionally trained caregivers but as members of families who needed to provide care for our own families. We really care and we understand your unique situation because we have been there ourselves. ‚ÄúWe Take the Worry Out of Caring for Someone You Love.‚Äù

What‚Äôs the difference between Living Care and other companies?

Living Care Home Services was started by Sean Lynch from his home in 2001. He was the first and only caregiver employed at the company for the first year. He worked day, middle and overnight shifts, personally escorted a client to Minnesota for a week to have a transplant check-up, worked with Hospice clients and was there holding their hand when they passed, and has worked with both male and female clients that first year. He has also had members of his own family receive home care services so understands the frustrations and the joy families can experience when getting outside help. This background helps meet client needs and better support the caregivers who are part of the household and those from our company.

I need help now‚Ä¶can you help me?

Absolutely. We are committed to every hour of care a family may require. Our team is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. We have a live answering service that can direct you to the right person to meet your needs after office hours. The service has been a part of our team for many years and understands your needs and will direct you accordingly. They will also listen to you, and make sure you get the help you need. We are committed to filling your needs within 24 hours or even the same day. We will do our best and we‚Äôll respect you and be honest with you if we can‚Äôt meet your requirements.

Do you provide care to clients in assisted living or other types of facilities?

Yes. Our caregivers have provided care to family members in many local facilities such as assisted living, nursing homes, hospitals, etc. All facilities are required to obtain caregiver information such as certification and TB testing. All our caregivers are current with these requirements which enhance our ability to respond to requests within facilities. Most of the local facilities recognize our diligence in meeting their requirements and work well with us in meeting your needs in their facility.

How much does care cost?

The cost of obtaining care depends upon the type of care you require. We have very affordable HOURLY rates which vary depending on the amount of time we spend with you. The longer we are with you, the less expensive your hourly rate will be. The rates are the same for weekday, weekend, and overnight hours. We also provide 24-hour Live-in care with a DAILY rate associated with that level of care. To obtain specific costs, please get in touch with us.

What if my situation changes and I need to change the service I receive?

We are flexible. We want to meet your needs and often those needs will change over time. We change with you. When you need a little more or a lot more help, we‚Äôll be there. When you need less care, we‚Äôll be there then too. You‚Äôre never locked onto services. As your needs change, we‚Äôll change to accommodate you.

Do you provide hospice care?

Yes. We are very proud of our non-medical hospice care services. We have individual caregivers with specific training in this area and only take hospice cases. These caregivers are special people who understand the hospice process and feel that it is their ‚Äúcalling‚Äù to help families navigate through this beautiful period of their life. This is a special time in someone‚Äôs life and the right caregiver can make all the difference in helping the individual and the family feel safe, well cared for, and understood.
